title: Fishermen Take the Lead in Tackling Ocean Plastic Pollution - The Fishing Daily
summary: Johnny Walsh, a respected figure in the fishing industry, is actively participating in an initiative to reduce ocean plastic waste. His fishing vessels will be closely monitored for plastic usage and collection at sea, with the data stored transparently through blockchain technology. For every kilogram of frozen langostino prawns sold under the Johnny Walsh brand, Ocean Integrity Group commits to removing one kilogram of ocean plastic.
product_or_process: Nylon 6 “monofilament” fishing nets, Nylon 66 and HDPE trawls
likely_naics_codes: ['339999: All Other Miscellaneous Manufacturing', '325412: Fish and Seafood Canning', '313251: Cut and Sew Apparel Manufacturing', '562211: Solid Waste Collection']

title: “The best is yet to come”: Tour operators outline goals for 2024 - Travelweek
summary: The travel and tourism industry experienced a strong recovery in 2023, with travel bookings surpassing pre-pandemic levels for many destinations and travel companies.    Several travel companies, including G Adventures, Globus, Goway, Intrepid Travel, Sunwing Vacations, and Transat, reported strong sales and are optimistic about 2024.    These companies are focused on sustainability and are implementing various initiatives to reduce their environmental impact, such as offering carbon-neutral tours, using sustainable aviation fuel, and reducing waste.
likely_naics_codes: ['492110 - Couriers', '561510 - Travel Agencies', '561520 - Tour Operators', '561599 - All Other Travel Arrangement and Reservation Services']

title: Dr. Saeeda Jaffar, senior VP & group country manager, Visa GCC - Economy Middle East
summary: Visa is pioneering transformative initiatives in the GCC region, including contactless solutions, sustainable finance, and financial inclusion. The company is committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2040 and has introduced the Visa Eco Benefits program to allow customers to calculate their transactional carbon footprint. Visa has also partnered with Emirates Nature-WWF for environmental conservation in the UAE.
green_innovation: TRUE, Visa's Eco Benefits program allows customers to calculate their transactional carbon footprint, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, Visa's installment solution for retail targets the retail market and provides flexibility and convenience for Visa credit cardholders to make installment payments in both online and in-store transactions.
